Description: Shoulder and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably an olpe; exterior: on shoulder, band of alternating added red and black tongues separated by dilute lines; on body, black-figure decoration consisting of part of large siren, to right (red dots on upper part of wing with broad band in red below; red dots on tail feathers and possibly on body).
Producer name: Attributed to a Follower of: The Tyrrhenian Group (possibly)
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.16)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 221, no. B65)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0039) (Phase 1)
